content.text: Ali and Ben receive a sum of money
They share it in the ratio 5 : 1
Ali uses \(11\%\) of his \(\) 2345\(to buy a television
Calculate the cost of the television
Ben buys one in a sale when this cost is reduced by \(15\%
\(\) 330\(is 12\% less than the cost last year
Ali invests \(\) 1500$ of his share in a bank account
The account pays compound interest at a rate of \(2.3\%\) per year
Calculate the total amount in the account at the end of 3 years
Ali also buys a computer for \(\) 325
He later sells this computer for \(\) 250
Shade the region which represents the nature reserve
In this question show all your construction arcs and use only a ruler and compasses the boundaries of your region
This scale drawing shows the positions of four towns, \(P\), \(Q\), \(R\) and \(S\), on a map where 1 cm represents \(10\mathrm{km}\)
A nature reserve lies in the quadrilateral \(PQR S\)
The boundaries of the nature reserve are:
Calculate the area of the lake
A fence is placed along part of the circumference of the lake
This arc subtends an angle of \(210^{\circ}\) at the centre of the circle
Calculate the length of the fence
A circular lake in the nature reserve has a radius of \(45 \mathrm{~m}\)
He wants to buy at least 5 goats
Write down an inequality in \(x\) to represent this condition
He wants to buy at least 11 sheep
Write down an inequality in \(y\) to represent this condition
He wants to buy at least 20 animals
Write down an inequality in \(x\) and \(y\) to represent this condition
Luk wants to buy \(x\) goats and \(y\) sheep
The maximum Luk can spend is \(\)160
Write down an inequality in \(x\) and \(y\) and show that it simplifies to \(x + 2y \leqslant 40\)
On the grid below, draw four lines to show the four inequalities and shade the unregions
Work out the maximum number of animals that Luk can buy
Calculate the volume of the prism
Calculate the angle between \(FJ\) and the base \(EGJH\) of the prism
The prism is melted and made into spheres
Work out the greatest number of spheres that can be made
[The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3.\) ]
A right-angled triangle is the cross section of another prism
This triangle has height \(4.5 \text{cm}\) and base \(11.0 \text{cm}\)
Both measurements are correct to 1 decimal place
Calculate the upper bound for the area of this triangle
Write your answer to part (e)(i) correct to 4 significant figures
_EFGHIJ_ is a solid metal prism of length \(40\mathrm{cm}\)
The cross section \(EFG\) is a right-angled triangle
Complete this table of values for the function \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{1}{x} - x^2\), \(x \neq 0\)
Draw the graph of \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{1}{x} - x^2\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant -0.2\) and \(0.2 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
By drawing a suitable line on your graph, solve the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 2x - 2.\)
By drawing a suitable tangent, work out an estimate of the gradient of the curve at the point where \(x = - 2.\)
Work out the probability that the two cards are of different colours
Give your answer as a fraction
In a box there are 7 red cards and 3 blue cards
A card is drawn at random from the box and is not replaced
A second card is then drawn at random from the box
Draw the image of shape \(A\) after a stretch, factor 3, \(x\)-axis invariant
Write down the matrix representing a stretch, factor 3, \(x\)-axis invariant
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
Write down the matrix representing the transformation which maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
\(A, B, C, D\) and \(E\) are points on the circle centre \(O\)
Another triangle \(XYZ\) is mathematically similar to triangle \(LMN.\)
\(XZ = 16 \text{cm}\) and the area of triangle \(LMN\) is \(324 \text{cm}^2\)
One of the 80 people is chosen at random
Find the probability that their journey to work took more than 35 minutes
Give your answer as a fraction
Use the cumulative frequency diagram to complete this frequency table

table.html:
Time (m minutes)0 < m ≤ 1010 < m ≤ 1515 < m ≤ 3030 < m ≤ 4040 < m ≤ 50
Frequency301218

content.text: Using mid-interval values, calculate an estimate of the mean journey time for the 80 people
Use the table in **part (c)** to complete the histogram to show the times taken by the 80 people
One column has already been completed for you
Sam asked 80 people how many minutes their journey to work took on one day
The cumulative frequency diagram shows the times taken (\(m\) minutes)
Work out the values of \(a\) and \(b\)
